docs.lead_paragraph: The Penitentiary Hospital, though dealing in general diseases, and containing within its wards cases of almost "all the ills that flesh is heir to," is more particularly appropriated to the care and cure of venereal diseases. It is the Syphilitic Hospital of New-York, and has come to be known as such.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Aldermen in Session. BOARD OF ASSISTANTS. ARREST OF A FEMALE SPIRIT REPPER " WOMAN'S NEW-YORK CITY TEMPERANCE ASSOCIATION." VERDICT IN THE COURSON DIVORCE CASE. VISIT OF THE NAVAL OFFICERS TO THE BRITISH FRIGATE. THE BRITISH COMMISSIONERS. FIRES. DEPARTURE OF THE BALTIMORE FIREMEN. SUICIDE OF A GERMAN. RECEPTION OF THE AMERICAN RIFLES AT BOSTON. DEPARTURE OF RECRUITS. DEPARTURE OF A CONSUL. SUDDEN DEATH. SEPERIOR COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board held their eighth meeting of the June Session, on Friday evening--RICHARD T. COMPTON, Esq., in the Chair. Present--Aldermen Sturtevant, Boyce, Tweed, Barr, Bard, Ward, Denman, Alvord, Doherty peck--barely a quorum.
docs.snippet: The Board held their eighth meeting of the June Session, on Friday evening--RICHARD T. COMPTON, Esq., in the Chair. Present--Aldermen Sturtevant, Boyce, Tweed, Barr, Bard, Ward, Denman, Alvord, Doherty peck--barely a quorum.

docs.lead_paragraph: Traveling has become an Institution; it should, therefore, be reduced to a science. From a rare and extraordinary necessity, it has become a practice of every day occurrence,. Of old, people were content to live at home; now, with multi tudes, home is but the central point in a scheme of travel, which leaves them but a scant fragment of time to enjoy its comforts.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New York Daily Times

headline.main: ALBANY.; Barbarous Treatment of Emigrants by the Central Railroad Company--Emigrants at New-York--The Maine Law Likely to Pass--Mr. Shaw and Mr. Speaker.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Petition was presented in the Assembly this morning, signed by more than fifty inhabitants of Amsterdam, Montgomery Co., including many of the most intelligent and respectable citizens of that place, representing that the Central Railroad Company is in the habit of treating emigrants with a cruel and barbarous disregard of the health, safety, and comfort, and asking for effective legislation to prevent the abuse.
docs.snippet: A Petition was presented in the Assembly this morning, signed by more than fifty inhabitants of Amsterdam, Montgomery Co., including many of the most intelligent and respectable citizens of that place, representing that the Central Railroad Company...

docs.lead_paragraph: We have a great many Temperance meetings,--a great many urgent Temperance addresses, and a formidable array of argument, of statistics and of exhortation, in favor of the enactment of a law positively prohibiting the sale of intoxicating drinks. But the most powerful advocates of the Maine Law in our City at the present moment, are its Excise Commissioners.

docs.lead_paragraph: That the Common Council have resolved to pay the offal contractor is a matter of no surprise, considering the resolution of those gentlemen to do whatever is nefarious and vile. Mr. WILLIAM B. REYNOLDS is to receive the four thousand seven hundred dollars per month, claimed by him and questioned by the Comptroller, for carrying carcasses and refuse out of the City.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most birds, except a few remarkable singers, almost all domestic animals, and the majority of men, do their work by daylight, or, at least, in the suburbs of day, retiring at night to sleep and repair the losses of their laboring hours by its refreshment.
